barter.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to exchange goods, work, or services for other goods or services rather than for money
barter.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I had to barter with the locals for food.
They bartered their grain for salt.
barter.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a system of exchanging goods and services for other goods and services rather than using money
barter.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Trading was carried out under a barter system.
barter.translation[1].definitions[1].def: goods or services that are exchanged by bartering
barter.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to exchange goods for other goods or to do work for someone in exchange for work they do for you, rather than using money
barter.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: They import used cars, which they then barter for consumer goods.
barter.translation[3].definitions[0].def: a system of exchanging goods or work for other goods or work, rather than using money
barter.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: When people want to exchange any goods, they do so by barter.
